prompt: The accident was happened yesterday.
explanation: happen은 자동사(1형식) → 수동태 불가. (The accident happened ...)

prompt: The accident happened yesterday.
A problem was arisen during the meeting.
explanation: arise는 자동사 → 수동태 불가. (A problem arose ...)

prompt: A problem arose during the meeting.
The team is consisted of ten members.
explanation: consist of는 자동사구 → 수동태(be consisted of) 불가. (consists of)

prompt: The team consists of ten members.
The committee is composed of ten members.
explanation: be composed of = ~로 구성되다(수동 가능 표현).

prompt: The book is belonged to me.
explanation: belong to는 자동사구 → 수동태 불가. (belongs to)

prompt: The book belongs to me.
We discussed about the problem.
We discussed the problem.
He resembles to his father.
explanation: resemble은 타동사 → to 없이 목적어 바로.

prompt: He resembles his father.
They approached to the station.
They approached the station.
She married with a doctor.
She married a doctor.
She is married to a doctor.
Please answer to the question.
Please answer the question.
We reached to the top of the mountain.
We reached the top of the mountain.
He entered into the room quietly.
He entered the room quietly.
He mentioned about the accident.
He mentioned the accident.
The man which lives here is my uncle.
The man who lives here is my uncle.
I bought the book which was pretty.
I bought the people which were pretty.
My brother, that lives in Seoul, is a teacher.
explanation: 콤마(,) 있는 계속적 용법에서는 that 사용 불가.

prompt: My brother, who lives in Seoul, is a teacher.
This is the best book that I've ever read.
explanation: 최상급 + 명사 뒤 관계대명사 → that 선호.

prompt: The house in that I live is old.
explanation: 전치사 + that 불가. (in which / that ... in)

prompt: The house in which I live is old.
I bought the book you love the most.
I bought the book which you love the most it.
explanation: 관계절은 불완전절이어야 함 → 목적어 it 중복 불가.

prompt: I remember the day when he arrived.
I don't remember the place where we last met.
I don't remember the place which we last met.
explanation: which 사용 시 전치사 필요: the place (which) we last met at.

prompt: The man whose car was stolen is angry.
I know the thing what he wants.
explanation: 선행사(the thing) 있으면 what 사용 불가 → which/that.

prompt: I know what he wants.
explanation: what = the thing which(선행사 없음) → 명사절/자유관계대명사.

prompt: You can take whatever you like.
explanation: whatever = anything that → 선행사 없이 사용.

prompt: The fact is that I like her.
What matters is that there should always be a small audience for him.
He is good at play soccer.
He is good at playing soccer.
The company prohibited him from promoting to vice president.
explanation: prohibit A from ~: A가 ~당하는 의미면 being p.p. 필요.

prompt: The company prohibited him from being promoted to vice president.
explanation: prohibit A from being p.p.: A가 ~되다(수동 의미).

prompt: He had no choice but to leave.
explanation: have no choice but to V = ~할 수밖에 없다.

prompt: He had no choice but leaving.
explanation: have no choice but to V 구조가 기본.

prompt: I enjoy to eat out.
I enjoy eating out.
I hope eating out tonight.
explanation: hope는 to부정사 선호: hope to V.

prompt: I hope to eat out tonight.
They had to keep the fire to burn for days.
explanation: keep + O + 목적격보어: 현재분사/형용사/과거분사 가능, to부정사 X.

prompt: They had to keep the fire burning for days.
Two factors have made it difficult for scientists to determine the number of species.
explanation: make + it(가목) + 형용사 + for + 사람 + to V(진목).

prompt: Two factors have made scientists difficult to determine the number of species.
explanation: 가목적어 it 없이 쓰면 scientists가 difficult가 되어 의미/구조가 틀어짐.

prompt: Being able to speak a language means communication.
Being able to speak a language mean communication.
explanation: 동명사구 주어는 단수 → mean X, means O.

prompt: The game industry needs to adapt quickly.
The game industry must adapt to changing conditions.
The game industry must adapt to quickly.
explanation: to가 전치사일 때 뒤에는 명사/동명사. quickly(부사) X.

prompt: Never have I met such a generous man before.
Never I have met such a generous man before.
explanation: Never 문두면 have I처럼 도치해야 함.

prompt: Hardly had I entered the house when you called.
Hardly have I entered the house when you called.
explanation: Hardly 도치 구문은 보통 had+p.p. 형태로 출제.

prompt: No sooner had I entered the house than the phone rang.
explanation: No sooner + had + S + p.p. ~ than ...

prompt: No sooner had I entered the house when the phone rang.
explanation: No sooner는 when이 아니라 than과 호응.

prompt: She likes reading and writing novels.
She likes reading and to write novels.
explanation: 병렬은 형태를 맞춰야 함: reading and writing / to read and to write.

prompt: Not only my brother but also my friends are crazy.
explanation: not only A but also B → 동사는 가까운 주어(B)에 수일치.

prompt: Not only my brother but also my friends is crazy.
He doesn't like it. Neither do I.
explanation: neither도 조동사 도치: neither + aux + S.

prompt: He doesn't like it. Neither I do.
explanation: neither 구문은 do I처럼 도치 필요.

prompt: The population of China is larger than Japan.
explanation: 비교 대상 통일: population vs Japan(나라) → that of Japan.

prompt: The population of China is larger than that of Japan.
explanation: that of + 명사: 앞의 단수명사(population) 대용.

prompt: He is superior than me.
He is superior to me.
explanation: superior to / inferior to 등은 to 사용.

prompt: John studies as happily as Mary does.
John studies as happy as Mary does.
explanation: 동사를 꾸미면 형용사 happy X → happily O.

prompt: A number of cars are in the museum.
The number of cars in the garage is increasing.
Many a student is absent today.
Many a student are absent today.
The rich are not always happy.
The rich is not always happy.
23% of the people are sick.
23% of the people is sick.
He is a teacher.
explanation: 가산 단수명사 직업 앞: a/an 필요.

prompt: He is teacher.
My friend gave me some advice.
My friend gave me many advices.
This furniture is expensive.
These furnitures are expensive.
He is tall enough to reach the shelf.
explanation: enough는 형용사/부사 뒤에 위치: tall enough.

prompt: He is enough tall to reach the shelf.
explanation: enough 위치 오류: enough tall X → tall enough O.

prompt: She made me clean my room.
She made me to clean my room.
I was made to clean my room.
I saw him enter the building.
I saw him to enter the building.
Ken got me to use his phone.
I helped him carry the bag.
It may sound strange.
It may sound strangely.
explanation: 감각동사 보어 자리에는 부사 X → 형용사.

prompt: Despite being tired, he worked late.
Despite he was tired, he worked late.
explanation: despite 뒤에 절(S+V) X → although/though 사용.

prompt: Although he was tired, he worked late.
Because of the rain, the game was canceled.
Because of it rained, the game was canceled.
explanation: because of 뒤에 절 X → because + 절.

prompt: With the door open, the room was cold.
With the door was open, the room was cold.
explanation: with구문은 'was open' 같은 완전절을 바로 못 씀.

prompt: With her hands full, she couldn't open the door.
With sunshine streaming through the window, she felt happy.
With sunshine streamed through the window, she felt happy.
explanation: with구문에는 과거시제(streamed) 같은 동사 형태 X.

prompt: I said that he was gone.
explanation: say는 '말한 내용'을 목적어로 취함. (사람 목적어 직접 X)

prompt: I said him that he was gone.
explanation: say는 사람 목적어를 바로 못 씀 → said to him / told him.

prompt: I told him that he was gone.
explanation: tell은 사람 목적어가 먼저: tell + 사람 + 내용.

prompt: I told that he was gone.
explanation: tell은 사람 목적어 없이 that절을 바로 받기 어려움.

prompt: He is lying on the bed.
He is laying on the bed.
He sat on the chair.
He seated on the chair.
The host seated the guests.
Prices are rising rapidly.
The government is rising taxes.
The government is raising taxes.
A new problem has arisen.
The doctor insisted that John lose weight.
explanation: 주장/요구/명령/제안 동사 + that절 → 동사 원형(should 생략).

prompt: The doctor insisted that John loses weight.
It is necessary that she (should) study hard.
It is necessary that she studies hard.
explanation: 시험형 문법: necessary that절 → study(원형) 사용.

prompt: The committee recommended that the old rule be abolished.
The committee recommended that the old rule was abolished.
explanation: mandative that절에서는 was가 아니라 be 원형.

prompt: He is said to have been a spy during the war.
explanation: 과거 사실을 현재에 '말해지다' → be said to have p.p.

prompt: He is said to be a spy during the war.
explanation: during the war(과거) 상황이면 to have been이 자연스럽다.

prompt: The bridge was believed to have collapsed.
explanation: collapse는 자동사 → to have collapsed(능동) 사용.

prompt: The bridge was believed to have been collapsed.
explanation: collapse는 자동사라 수동형(to have been collapsed) 불가.

prompt: The file was found to have been deleted.
explanation: 삭제 '당함' 의미 → to have been p.p.

prompt: The file was found to have deleted.
explanation: file이 삭제하는 주체가 아님 → to have been deleted.

prompt: She is such a smart girl.
She is so smart a girl.
She is such smart a girl.
explanation: such는 a/an 앞에 와야 함: such a smart girl.

prompt: She is so a smart girl.
explanation: so는 형용사 바로 앞: so smart a girl / so smart.

prompt: Almost students passed the exam.
explanation: almost는 부사 → 명사 바로 수식 X. (almost all students)

prompt: Almost all students passed the exam.
During the class, he fell asleep.
During he was in class, he fell asleep.
explanation: during 뒤에 절(S+V) X → while 사용.

prompt: While he was in class, he fell asleep.
